block.p: Dr. Alison Fischer Kitay, a daughter of Evelyn G. Kitay and Michael G. Kitay of Washington, was married yesterday to Dr. Edwin Numsuwan, a son of Wanpen and Vanchai Numsuwan of Kendall Park, N.J. Rabbi Jonathan J. Prinz, a cousin of the bride, officiated at the Four Seasons Biltmore Hotel in Santa Barbara, Calif.

The bride, 28, will continue to use her name professionally. Tomorrow, she will begin a residency in orthopedic surgery at the Hospital for Special Surgery in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Amherst College and received her medical degree from New York University.

Dr. Alison Fischer Kitay, a daughter of Evelyn G. Kitay and Michael G. Kitay of Washington, was married yesterday to Dr. Edwin Numsuwan, a son of Wanpen and Vanchai Numsuwan of Kendall Park, N.J. Rabbi Jonathan J. Prinz, a cousin of the bride, officiated at the Four Seasons Biltmore Hotel in Santa Barbara, Calif.

Dr. Alison Fischer Kitay, a daughter of Evelyn G. Kitay and Michael G. Kitay of Washington, was married yesterday to Dr. Edwin Numsuwan, a son of Wanpen and Vanchai Numsuwan of Kendall Park, N.J. Rabbi Jonathan J. Prinz, a cousin of the bride, officiated at the Four Seasons Biltmore Hotel in Santa Barbara, Calif.

The bride, 28, will continue to use her name professionally. Tomorrow, she will begin a residency in orthopedic surgery at the Hospital for Special Surgery in New York. She graduated magna cum laude from Amherst College and received her medical degree from New York University.

Her father retired as an assistant general counsel in Washington for the United States Agency for International Development. He now works in Bethesda, Md., as the general counsel for the international division of Abt Associates, a research and consulting firm with headquarters in Cambridge, Mass. Her mother is an associate general counsel for the Surface Transportation Board in Washington, an independent federal agency that regulates railroad matters such as rail construction and rates.

The bridegroom, 29, will be joining the University of Pennsylvania department of rehabilitation medicine next month as an assistant professor. He graduated magna cum laude from Rutgers and received a medical degree from the Robert Wood Johnson Medical School of the University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey in New Brunswick.

His mother is the supervisor of the microbiology laboratory at St. Peter's University Hospital in New Brunswick, N.J. His father retired as a senior research scientist at Johnson & Johnson in Raritan, N.J.
